**[Cross-country skiing](/wiki/Cross-country_skiing_\(sport\) "Cross-country
skiing \(sport\)")** has been contested at the **[Winter Olympic
Games](/wiki/Winter_Olympic_Games "Winter Olympic Games")** since the first
Winter Games in [1924](/wiki/1924_Winter_Olympics "1924 Winter Olympics") in
[Chamonix](/wiki/Chamonix "Chamonix"), [France](/wiki/France "France"). The
women's events were first contested at the [1952 Winter
Olympics](/wiki/1952_Winter_Olympics "1952 Winter Olympics").

qa.question: when did cross country skiing become an olympic sport

It also mentions cross-country skiing as part of the winter pentathlon, which was a demonstration event in 1948.

triviaqa_34025_60.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document does not directly mention the year 1924 in relation to cross country skiing.
triviaqa_34025_60.Key Information Matching: While the document mentions cross-country skiing, it does so in a different context (as part of the winter pentathlon in 1948) and does not provide the specific year when it became an official Olympic sport.
